intro: Zapoteca andina, commonly known as the Andean zapoteca, is a species of flowering plant native to the highlands of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, broad ovate leaves, and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
